ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: His heart did not lie about what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: His heart did not falsify what he perceived.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: His heart added no untruth to what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: His (Muhammad's) heart did not lie to him about what his eyes had seen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The heart did not deny, what it saw. (The Holy Prophet was bestowed with seeing Allah – see also preceding verses 8, 9, 10.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The heart lied not in what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The heart was not untrue in (making him see) what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: His heart lies not of what he saw;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The heart [of the Prophet] did not misconstrue what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The heart lied not in that which he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The heart did not deny what it saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The (Prophet's) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The (Prophet's) heart lied not (in seeing) what he (Muhammad SAW) saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: His heart did not lie of what he saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The heart did not lie about what it saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The heart did not lie [about] what it saw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:11] The heart, the heart of the Prophet, did not deny (read khadhaba or kadhdhaba) what he saw, with his own eyes of the image of Gabriel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The heart) of Muhammad (pbuh) (lied not (in seeing) what it saw) when he saw his Lord with his heart; it is also said that he saw his Lord with his eyes. This is why Allah made His oath.
